title: Joel Edgerton hits Sydney's Bondi Beach for a swim ahead of the premiere of The King
text:
He's currently on the promotional trail for his new movie, The King, but Joel Edgerton appeared happy to be home on Thursday.

The 45-year-old actor seemed determined to make the most of his trip back to Australia, visiting Sydney's famous Bondi Beach.

Despite what has undoubtedly been a gruelling promotional schedule, the talented star made time for a quick swim at the famous beach.

Home sweet home: He's currently on the promotional trail for his new movie, The King, but Joel Edgerton appeared happy to be home on Thursday, swimming at Sydney's Bondi Beach

A soaking wet Joel was seen emerging from the surf, as he made his way back up the sand.

Wearing a pair of khaki coloured boardshorts, the bearded actor was seen clenching his fists as he walked out of the water.

Just moments earlier, he was seen emerging from under the water, his wet hair falling across his face.

Cooling off: Despite what has undoubtedly been a gruelling promotional schedule, the talented star made time for a quick swim at the beach

Under the sea: The talented actor was seen emerging from under the water, his wet hair falling across his face

His swim came just hours before Joel stepped out for the film's Sydney premiere later that same night.

The King tells the story of a young Henry V shortly after he inherited the throne from his late brother.

In addition to starring in the film alongside Timothée Chalamet, Lily-Rose Depp, Ben Mendelsohn and Robert Pattinson, Joel also wrote and produced it.

Multi-talented: In addition to starring in The King alongside a star-studded cast, Joel also wrote and produced it

Speaking to The Hollywood Reporter earlier this month, Joel said he'd studied Shakespearean English to get the language right.

'We mined Shakespeare for the elements that we wanted, but we decided to separate from his text completely. If we were to use one line of Shakespeare, we would use it all. And we weren't gonna do that,' he said.

'We decided that we would include our own investigation into true history and we gave ourselves artistic license to create whatever we wanted.'
description: He's currently on the promotional trail for his new movie, The King, but Joel Edgerton appeared happy to be home on Thursday, visiting Sydney's famous Bondi Beach for a swim.
authors: Demeter Stamell For Daily Mail Australia
